# Introduction

Republic of Korea's birth rate is at it's all time low and it has just dipped below 1 birth per women, which means that 
population is at a tipping point. It is the second lowest in the world, after Taiwan In this paper we examine possible reasons for it and perform regression models to further predict whether the birthrate will continue to decrease 

it is similar with other high income countries
